title: Ticket #2810: DAGman enhancement plans for Condor version 7.9
description:
This is a ticket to keep a record of suggestions and plans for enhancements to DAGman in Condor version 7.9.

remarks:
2012-Feb-07 14:17:12 by nwp:
Initial suggestions:

  1. Make SPLICE == "SUBDAG INTERNAL", this probably goes along with #439 and #2649, among others.
  2. Create a dagman-check tool, as in #2166
  3. Create a method to change dagman runtime parameters, as in #2616
  4. A DAGman creation tool, as in #2646.

2012-Feb-07 14:57:25 by wenger:
Here are my initial ideas (prioritized mainly by feedback from users):
  1. #2807 (Have DAGMan use a single node job user log file). If we did that, it would also take care of #2428, #2759, #2772, #445 (partially), #831, maybe #2645, #659, and #2702. A number of users have run into problems related to this.
  2. #2380 (Have option to run DAG Pre/Post scripts as starter Pre/Post scripts) -- LIGO wants this.
  3. #572 (Be able to force DAG nodes to run on the same machine) -- a bunch of people have wanted this.
  4. #2111 (Config values are propagated from top-level DAGs to sub-DAGs). This is actually a bug fix rather than a new feature, so maybe it should get aimed at 7.7.6.

2012-Feb-07 15:12:00 by wenger:
Here are a couple more:
  • #171 (Be able to save output of PRE and POST scripts).
  • #1756 (Be able to dynamically add nodes to a running DAG).

2012-Feb-07 15:21:53 by nwp:

Another item that should go on here is "socket nodes", mentioned in passing in #1751. The idea is to support PRE and POST scripts for SPLICES, also it has some relation to the idea above of making SPLICE == SUBDAG INTERNAL.

2012-Apr-09 12:19:18 by nwp:
From condor-admin 23353: 

Currently, DAGman children only start running when ALL parent nodes have
completed. In many cases, like stochastic modeling and simulation, it is not
required that all nodes at a given step complete. Additionally, we have noted
that there can be significant variability in run times that often create a
'long tail' of run times. For example, 85% of nodes at a given level may
complete in 20 minutes, while the remaining 15% may take up to 60 minutes.

In these cases, significant workflow step speedups can be attained if the
requirement that all parents complete before a child starts executing would be
relaxed.

It would be advantageous to enable a user to specify the condition upon which a
child can begin processing. For example a user may specify that a certain
number  or percentage of parent nodes complete, or that parents are only
allowed to run for a given amount of (wall clock) time.

While we leave it to the Condor developers to determine the best implementation
path, we suggest that this feature may best be implemented by providing the
user with two tools: 1) a tool that lets a user query the number of completed
parents for a given child and 2) a tool that let's a user say "I want child X
to begin processing =97 do the right thing to clean up any still running
parents, etc.). In these cases, it would be helpful to 'signal' the parent
workflow step that it has been marked as 'no longer required' so that the post
script could behave accordingly (perhaps by returning or outputting some
default value).
